In case you are wondering...

If your child is having difficulty logging onto the district provided Chromebook device, please send an email to passwordhelp@cvsd356.org and we will work to resolve the issue as soon as we can.

Can I use my own Chromebook?
If you have your own personal Chromebook, then you can use that and log in with the students CVSD username/email and password and it will work just as if it was a CVSD Chromebook.

CVSD schools will close effective on Monday March 16th until April 24th.

3/15/20 UPDATE 12:50pm:

Our district team has worked today to evaluate whether or not to continue operating school on Monday. We have been made aware of many connections to the Robotic competition in West Valley and although these connections may not yet be confirmed by Spokane Regional Health Department, we have made the decision to cancel school on Monday, March 16th.

We do not take this decision lightly. We do so out of an abundance of caution and with a heavy heart for our students. However, we believe it is the best decision for our students, staff and community at this time.

We will continue with our plans to provide meals to our students beginning on Tuesday, March 17th. More details on the meal service to follow by tomorrow morning.

Thank you for your continued patience and support during this uncertainty! As we work through this situation together as a Central Valley community, we will do so with the care and compassion for which we are known.

CVSD Parents:

After consideration of feedback from the June 18, 2019, Parent Preview Night for the 6-12th Grade Sexual Health Education Materials, we feel that we need to adjust our timeline to allow more time for parents to review materials and provide additional comments.

We do not want to rush this process, and so we will be postponing the presentation to our School Board of Directors that was originally scheduled on Monday, June 24.

In respect to our families busy summer schedules, we will schedule additional Parent Preview meetings in late summer or early fall to gather additional input from parents. This information will then be taken back to the Curriculum Committee to consider any further adjustments or recommendations, prior to being presented to the School Board.

We know that this is an important topic, and we will let parents know as soon as we have the next Parent Preview meetings scheduled. We appreciate the valuable feedback.

HELP KEEP OUR KIDS SAFE

Wondering when to stop for the school bus? Here are some pointers. When in doubt, stop. Safety is our top priority.

‚Ä¢ Traffic going the same direction as the school bus must stop when the stop sign ‚Äúpaddle‚Äù is extended and its red lights are flashing. Do not resume travel until the red lights stop flashing and the stop-arm is retracted.
‚Ä¢ Drivers traveling in the opposite direction must stop on two-lane roads, but not if the roadway has three or more lanes, including turn lanes.
‚Ä¢ If there is a median/island between the opposing directions, traffic going the same direction as the bus needs to stop, but opposing traffic does not.

The traffic citation is $430 for passing a school bus while it is loading/unloading passengers.
